meals.name: Breakfast
meals.rationale: Breakfast should be high in carbohydrates and moderate in protein to provide energy for the morning workouts. The low-fat and low-fiber nature of this meal helps prevent gastrointestinal distress. (ACSM2016, ISSN2017)

meals.name: Pre-Workout Snack
meals.rationale: A small, easily digestible carbohydrate snack 30-60 minutes before the workout can help maintain blood glucose levels and improve performance. (ACSM2016, ISSN2017)

meals.name: Intra-Workout 1

foods.item: 500 ml sports drink (6% carb, 300 mg/L sodium)

meals.rationale: During the 60-minute moderate run, a sports drink can help maintain blood glucose levels and provide necessary electrolytes. (ACSM2016, ISSN2017)

meals.name: Intra-Workout 2

foods.item: 500 ml sports drink (6% carb, 300 mg/L sodium)

meals.rationale: A second sports drink during the second 60-minute moderate run helps maintain hydration and energy levels. (ACSM2016, ISSN2017)

meals.name: Post-Workout 1

foods.item: 1 recovery shake (40 g maltodextrin, 20 g whey, 700 ml water, 3 g leucine, 500 mg sodium)

meals.rationale: Post-workout nutrition should focus on rapid glycogen recovery and muscle repair. A recovery shake with a 2:1 carb:protein ratio and added sodium helps achieve these goals. (ACSM2016, ISSN2017, Morton2018)

meals.name: Lunch
meals.rationale: Lunch should provide a balanced mix of carbohydrates, protein, and moderate fat to support recovery and provide sustained energy. Keeping fat and fiber low helps with digestion and absorption. (ISSN2017, ACSM2016)
israel_alternatives: Strauss Achla hummus on rice cakes

meals.name: Snack
meals.rationale: A mid-afternoon snack with carbohydrates and protein helps maintain energy levels and supports muscle recovery. Low-fat yogurt and honey provide easy-to-digest nutrients. (ACSM2016, ISSN2017)

meals.name: Dinner
meals.rationale: Dinner should be a substantial meal with a mix of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats to support recovery and provide nutrients for the next day's training. Quinoa and mixed berries offer a good balance of carbs and antioxidants. (ISSN2017, ACSM2016)

meals.name: Evening Snack
meals.rationale: An evening snack with a mix of carbohydrates and protein helps prevent muscle breakdown and supports glycogen synthesis overnight. (ISSN2017, ACSM2016)

key_recommendations: Ensure adequate hydration with electrolytes before and during workouts to maintain performance and prevent hyponatremia. (ACSM2016, McCubbin2025)
Consume a high-carb meal 3-4 hours before the workouts to top off glycogen stores. (ISSN2017, ACSM2016)
Ingest a small carbohydrate snack 30-60 minutes before the workouts to maintain blood glucose levels. (ISSN2017)
After each workout, consume a recovery shake with a 2:1 carb:protein ratio to expedite glycogen re-synthesis and muscle repair. (ACSM2016, ISSN2017)
Distribute protein intake evenly throughout the day to maximize muscle protein synthesis. (ISSN2017, Morton2018)

meals.name: Breakfast

foods.item: Oatmeal with banana and a scoop of whey protein

meals.rationale: Oatmeal provides a good source of low-fiber carbohydrates, which are essential for topping off glycogen stores before a morning workout. Adding a banana and whey protein ensures a balanced intake of carbs and protein, as recommended for pre-workout meals (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: Israeli-style yogurt with honey and dates
Shakshuka with a side of pita bread

meals.name: Pre-Workout Snack
meals.rationale: A banana provides a quick, easily digestible source of carbohydrates, while a sports drink ensures hydration and electrolyte balance, especially sodium, which is crucial for maintaining fluid balance and preventing hyponatremia (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: A small piece of white bread with honey
A small bowl of Israeli-style cereal with low-fat milk

meals.name: Intra-Workout Fuel
meals.rationale: A sports drink during a 60-minute moderate run helps maintain blood glucose levels and provides necessary sodium to replace sweat losses. This is particularly important for maintaining performance and hydration (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: A diluted fruit juice with added salt

meals.name: Post-Workout Recovery

foods.item: Grilled chicken breast with quinoa and steamed vegetables

meals.rationale: A balanced meal with quinoa and chicken provides a 3:1 ratio of carbohydrates to protein, which is optimal for rapid glycogen recovery and muscle repair after a moderate-intensity workout. The inclusion of sodium helps rehydrate effectively (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: Israeli salad with grilled chicken and pita bread
Falafel with a side of hummus and vegetables
Shawarma with a side of rice and vegetables

meals.name: Lunch

foods.item: Turkey sandwich with whole grain bread and avocado

meals.rationale: A turkey sandwich with whole grain bread and avocado provides a balanced mix of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats. The sodium content helps maintain electrolyte balance, especially after a morning workout (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: Shakshuka with a side of rice
Grilled fish with a side of couscous and vegetables

meals.name: Pre-Workout Snack

foods.item: White rice with a small piece of lean beef

meals.rationale: White rice is a low-fiber, easily digestible carbohydrate source, and lean beef provides a good amount of protein. This meal is designed to top off glycogen stores and provide the necessary nutrients for the second workout of the day (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: Pita bread with a small amount of hummus
Israeli-style pasta with a side of lean chicken
A small bowl of rice with a side of grilled vegetables

meals.name: Intra-Workout Fuel
meals.rationale: Similar to the morning intra-workout fuel, a sports drink helps maintain blood glucose levels and replace sodium lost through sweat during the second moderate run. This supports sustained performance and hydration (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: A diluted fruit juice with added salt

meals.name: Post-Workout Recovery

foods.item: Protein shake with maltodextrin and fructose

meals.rationale: A protein shake with maltodextrin and fructose provides a high-GI carbohydrate and high-quality protein, which is essential for rapid glycogen recovery and muscle repair after the second workout. The sodium content aids in rehydration (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: Greek yogurt with fruit and granola
A small bowl of protein-rich soup with rice

meals.name: Dinner

foods.item: Salmon with sweet potato and steamed broccoli

meals.rationale: Salmon is a rich source of omega-3 fatty acids, which can aid in recovery and reduce inflammation. Sweet potato and broccoli provide a mix of carbohydrates and nutrients, ensuring a balanced meal to support ongoing recovery needs (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: Grilled chicken with couscous and vegetables
Israeli-style fish with a side of quinoa and salad

meals.name: Snack

foods.item: Greek yogurt with honey and a handful of almonds

meals.rationale: Greek yogurt with honey and almonds provides a mix of protein and carbohydrates to support ongoing recovery and muscle repair. The low-fat content ensures quick digestion, and the sodium helps maintain electrolyte balance (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
israel_alternatives: A small bowl of Israeli-style yogurt with fruit
Pita bread with a small amount of tahini
A handful of dried fruits and nuts

key_recommendations: Ensure adequate carbohydrate intake (560g) to support high-volume training and maintain glycogen stores (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
Incorporate protein (126g) evenly throughout the day to maximize muscle protein synthesis (Morton2018, ISSN2017).
Maintain hydration with electrolyte-rich fluids, especially before and during workouts, to replace sweat losses and prevent hyponatremia (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
Consume a balanced meal with a 3:1 carbohydrate to protein ratio immediately after each workout to expedite recovery (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
Monitor sodium intake (4000mg) to ensure proper electrolyte balance, particularly important for endurance athletes in base training (ACSM2016, ISSN2017).
